<a href="https://www.christopher-cloos.com?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=TMB" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Christopher Cloos" style="width:100%;max-width: 160px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="160" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTYwNzczMzUxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>
</th>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p class="p1" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning.</strong> As we prep our thoughts and waistbands for Thanksgiving tomorrow, we wanted to say how extremely grateful we are that you read the Brew. Yes, we joke around a lot (sometimes too much), but it’s humbling to know that you set aside five minutes, whether it’s in bed, on the subway, or at work, to explore this amazing world with us. We may not know you, but…it kinda feels like we do.</p>
<p class="p1" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before you reach for the Kleenex, note that we will be OFF tomorrow, back with a special edition on Black Friday, then return with regularly scheduled programming on Monday. Happy Thanksgiving to you and your family.</p>
</td>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/26/bloomberg-news-gets-pickle-covering-bloomberg-candidate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
OK, Bloomberg
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mike Bloomberg" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0Nzk2NTgzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gage Skidmore</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Former NYC Mayor Michael Bloomberg <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/24/us/politics/michael-bloomberg-2020-presidency.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">officially declared</a> his bid for the U.S. presidency on Sunday. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bloomberg is the richest person ever to run. And...he’s flexing his $54 billion fortune early on. He threw down </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/22/us/politics/bloomberg-ads-2020-race.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at least $30 million</a></span><span> for a single week of TV ads—that’s more than his non-billionaire Democratic rivals spent on TV ads this year combined.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s a problem for one biz-focused NYC newsroom </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not us—we’re all stocked up on jumbo soda jokes. The announcement puts employees at Bloomberg LP, the news, software, and financial info company Michael co-founded in 1981, in a tough spot. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>CNN </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/26/media/mike-bloomberg-2020-reliable-sources/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a></span><span> that some Bloomberg muckrakers are frustrated about how the campaign could affect their raking. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last Sunday, Bloomberg Editor-in-Chief John Micklethwait <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/24/media/bloomberg-news-presidential-race/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issued a memo</a> that outlined the political team’s strategy. Which is: They won’t investigate Bloomberg or any of his Democratic rivals to avoid favoritism. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They’ll </span><span><em>cover</em></span><span> Bloomberg and the Democrats; they just won’t break out the money-following investigative big guns. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As for President Trump, they’ll continue those deep investigations because he’s a sitting president, not just a candidate. But if Bloomberg wins the nomination (</span><span><a href="https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/how-michael-bloombergs-late-bid-for-the-democratic-nomination-could-go/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">analysts say</a></span><span> his chances are slim), they’ll have to revisit.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Taking a step back</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">News accounts for an undisclosed but probably minimal chunk of Bloomberg LP’s ~$11 billion in annual revenue, according to the FT. Out of nearly 20,000 total workers, the news division employs 2,700 reporters and editors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, the company’s faced this issue before. Bloomberg was mayor of NYC from 2002 to 2013. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Of that time spent covering Bloomberg in Gracie Mansion, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/7594681c-0fd0-11ea-a7e6-62bf4f9e548a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one reporter said</a></span><span> it was a tall order even as most of the stories were only made available to high-paying Bloomberg Terminal subscribers. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Now that Bloomberg reporting is accessible to more people, the newsroom’s choice not to cover the boss man in-depth carries more weight. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There is one NYC enclave cheering Bloomberg’s entry: <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/cb390bbe-07ed-11ea-a984-fbbacad9e7dd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Wall Street</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Did this story whet your election appetite? </strong><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-turnout/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=turnout&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Subscribe to The Turnout</a>, Morning Brew’s new weekly newsletter on the intersection of business and politics.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/26/several-data-points-show-strength-housing-market?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There's No Place Like Home Data
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="gold house " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0ODA2OTkxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like wise men and bean salads, all good housing data comes in threes. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><span><strong style="color:#000">New home sales</strong> <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-26/u-s-new-home-sales-post-two-best-months-in-more-than-12-years?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rode a</a> 12+ year high in September and October despite an unexpected dip in October, per Commerce Dept. data released yesterday.</span></span><span> October new home sales were up almost 32% annually with a seasonally adjusted 733,000 units. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The S&P Case-Shiller Index </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/26/home-prices-gains-accelerate-in-september-sp-case-shiller-index-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> a 3.2% increase in </span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S.</strong></span><span> </span><span><strong style="color:#000">home prices</strong></span><span> in September. Commerce data pinned median October home sales at $316,700, just enough for a cupboard under the stairs in NYC. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>About two-thirds of October sales were units under construction or still to be built, indicating a housing pipeline strong as a sistered floor joist.</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Home starts</strong></span><span>, or permits for new home construction, also hit a 12+ year high in October.</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it all means: </strong>In recent months, historically low mortgage rates and gains in jobs and wages have <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-economy-housing/us-new-home-sales-fall-in-october-september-revised-higher-idUSLNSQMEFE0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fortified</a> the housing market, which has helped prop up a slowing economy. But tight inventory and high demand could push home prices to uncomfortable levels.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/26/papa-john-swipes-papa-johns-pizza?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Papa John Is Serving This Revenge Pizza Cold
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="kermit sipping " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=375 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o85xGocUH8RYoDKKs/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="kermit sipping " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o85xGocUH8RYoDKKs/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Papa John’s founder John Schnatter recently <a href="https://www.wdrb.com/news/as-papa-john-s-moves-on-without-its-founder-john/article_b249cd6a-0fd0-11ea-98be-57e90d623b95.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spilled</a> the whole teapot to Louisville TV station WDRB, announcing he’s so disillusioned with his former company that he’s reduced his stake as largest shareholder. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The highlight was Schnatter confessing to eating over 40 pizzas in the last 30 days. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Schnatter said the pizza is </span><span><span>"not the same product. It just doesn't taste as good.</span></span><span>” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But he still ate 40+ pizzas </span><span><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/232/thinking-face_1f914.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Schnatter criticized new CEO Rob Lynch, who he says “<span>doesn't really know quality</span>” or have pizza experience. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Lynch, the former Arby’s president, guided Papa John’s to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/06/papa-johns-pzza-q3-2019-earnings-fall-short.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat</a></span><span> sales expectations last quarter. Shares are up almost 41% since he joined in late August. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Perhaps it’s the aftertaste of resentment? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Schnatter <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2018/07/10/papa-johns-founder-john-schnatter-resigns-as-chairman-of-company-boar.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resigned</a> as chairman in 2018 following backlash to his use of a racial slur on a conference call...about diversity training. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Schnatter says he “didn’t say anything that was racist” and his words <span>were intentionally taken out of context by</span> company insiders who wanted him out. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Schnatter said to “stay tuned” because “the day of reckoning will come.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Lock it in:</strong> ESPN launches the pizza documentary series <em>40 for 30</em>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/26/dicks-dollar-tree-best-buy-report-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Clear Eyes, Full Carts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="friday night lights " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/2jMze7eQmm1u2lzshT/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="friday night lights " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/2jMze7eQmm1u2lzshT/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If yesterday’s retail earnings were football movies, <strong style="color:#000">Dick’s would be <em>Remember the Titans</em>.</strong> The company showed the triumph of the human spirit and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/26/dicks-sporting-goods-dks-reports-q3-2019-earnings-beat-ups-outlook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported its</a> best comparable sales figures since 2013, with e-commerce sales leaping 13%. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The retailer’s </span><span><a href="https://fortune.com/2018/02/28/dicks-sporting-goods-guns/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decision last February</a></span><span> to stop selling assault-style rifles doesn’t seem to have hurt it. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best Buy is <em>We Are Marshall</em>:</strong> It pays to get creative. The electronics retailer <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/26/best-buy-earnings-3q-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted</a> top and bottom line beats in part <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/best-buys-health-offerings-now-serving-1-million-seniors-with-a-goal-of-5-million-in-fiscal-2025-2019-11-26?mod=home-page&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">by expanding</a> health services that seniors can access from their homes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Best Buy did almost $9.8 billion in sales last quarter. Comparable sales, retail’s favorite metric, rose 1.7%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Dollar Tree is <em>Friday Night Lights</em>:</strong> Things don’t always go how you’d hope. It <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/dollar-tree-stock-slides-as-earnings-miss-expectations-51574776278?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missed</a> earnings expectations as the trade war and its Family Dollar brand squeezed margins. It just barely beat revenue projections. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After Dollar Tree cut its Q4 forecast, its stock slid over 15%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>retailers are betting convenience and “experiences” will win out this holiday season. And whatever the opposite of betting is, they’re doing it on a round of U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods slated for Dec. 15.</p>

tomorrow, we wanted to say how extremely grateful we are that you read the Brew. Yes, we joke around a lot (sometimes too much), but it’s humbling to know that you set aside five minutes, whether it’s in bed, on the subway, or at work, to explore this amazing world with us. We may not know you, but…it kinda feels like we do.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp class=\"p1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBefore you reach for the Kleenex, note that we will be OFF tomorrow, back with a special edition on Black Friday, then return with regularly scheduled programming on Monday. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\n2020\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Bloomberg\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Mike Bloomberg\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0Nzk2NTgzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGage Skidmore\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFormer NYC Mayor Michael Bloomberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/24/us/politics/michael-bloomberg-2020-presidency.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficially declared\u003c/a\u003e his bid for the U.S. presidency on Sunday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBloomberg is the richest person ever to run. And...he’s flexing his $54 billion fortune early on. He threw down \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/22/us/politics/bloomberg-ads-2020-race.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat least $30 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for a single week of TV ads—that’s more than his non-billionaire Democratic rivals spent on TV ads this year combined.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s a problem for one biz-focused NYC newsroom \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot us—we’re all stocked up on jumbo soda jokes. The announcement puts employees at Bloomberg LP, the news, software, and financial info company Michael co-founded in 1981, in a tough spot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCNN \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/26/media/mike-bloomberg-2020-reliable-sources/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that some Bloomberg muckrakers are frustrated about how the campaign could affect their raking. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast Sunday, Bloomberg Editor-in-Chief John Micklethwait \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/24/media/bloomberg-news-presidential-race/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissued a memo\u003c/a\u003e that outlined the political team’s strategy. Which is: They won’t investigate Bloomberg or any of his Democratic rivals to avoid favoritism. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThey’ll \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ecover\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Bloomberg and the Democrats; they just won’t break out the money-following investigative big guns. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs for President Trump, they’ll continue those deep investigations because he’s a sitting president, not just a candidate. But if Bloomberg wins the nomination (\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/how-michael-bloombergs-late-bid-for-the-democratic-nomination-could-go/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanalysts say\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e his chances are slim), they’ll have to revisit.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTaking a step back\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNews accounts for an undisclosed but probably minimal chunk of Bloomberg LP’s ~$11 billion in annual revenue, according to the FT. Out of nearly 20,000 total workers, the news division employs 2,700 reporters and editors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, the company’s faced this issue before. Bloomberg was mayor of NYC from 2002 to 2013. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOf that time spent covering Bloomberg in Gracie Mansion, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/7594681c-0fd0-11ea-a7e6-62bf4f9e548a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone reporter said\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e it was a tall order even as most of the stories were only made available to high-paying Bloomberg Terminal subscribers. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNow that Bloomberg reporting is accessible to more people, the newsroom’s choice not to cover the boss man in-depth carries more weight. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere is one NYC enclave cheering Bloomberg’s entry: \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/cb390bbe-07ed-11ea-a984-fbbacad9e7dd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWall Street\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Did this story whet your election appetite? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-26/u-s-new-home-sales-post-two-best-months-in-more-than-12-years?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" released yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e October new home sales were up almost 32% annually with a seasonally adjusted 733,000 units. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe S\u0026P Case-Shiller Index \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/26/home-prices-gains-accelerate-in-september-sp-case-shiller-index-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a 3.2% increase in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ehome prices\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in September. Commerce data pinned median October home sales at $316,700, just enough for a cupboard under the stairs in NYC. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAbout two-thirds of October sales were units under construction or still to be built, indicating a housing pipeline strong as a sistered floor joist.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e Home starts\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, or permits for new home construction, also hit a 12+ year high in October.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it all means: \u003c/strong\u003eIn recent months, historically low mortgage rates and gains in jobs and wages have \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-economy-housing/us-new-home-sales-fall-in-october-september-revised-higher-idUSLNSQMEFE0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efortified\u003c/a\u003e the housing market, which has helped prop up a slowing economy.
